message: I'm excited to offer you this great product at a competitive price. I think you'll really love it!
Thank you for the offer. I appreciate the product, but I'm looking to keep my spending within a certain budget. Could we perhaps aim for a price closer to $150?
I understand that you're looking to keep your spending within budget, but I need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to charge at least $160 for the product.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still aiming to keep the price closer to my budget. Would it be possible to reach an agreement around $140?
I'm getting a bit concerned that we're not meeting in the middle, but I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer the product to you for $155, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I see that we're close to reaching an agreement. I would like to propose a price of $150, which I believe is fair for both of us.

I've made concessions, but I still need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you at $152, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
Considering our previous discussions, I'd like to propose a price of $150. I hope this aligns better with what you're able to offer while also staying within my budget.

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated with the back-and-forth, but I'm willing to give it one more try. I can offer the product to you for $158, but that's really the absolute minimum I'm willing to accept. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I appreciate your persistence in trying to find a common ground. Based on our previous negotiations, I would like to propose a final offer of $150 for the product.
